maple.core

Class MapleFunction

  • java.lang.Object
    • maple.core.MapleFunction

  • public abstract class MapleFunction
extends java.lang.Object
    This is the main class for writing network controllers using Maple. You define an algorithmic policy by defining a subclass of the MapleFunction class. The subclass must override the onPacket method. This method may access attributes of the Packet object passed to the method and may access network state attributes such as switches and links variables. There are also a variety of callback functions that can be overridden to receive notifications of various events.

      • edgePorts

        public java.util.Set<SwitchPort> edgePorts()
        Returns:
        The set of switch-port pairs that are not used to connect between switches; i.e. those ports which can be the locations of hosts.

      • hostLocation

        public SwitchPort hostLocation(long mac)
        Returns:
        The location (specified as switch-port pair) of the host identified by the input MAC address (specified as a Long int). This function returns null if the host location is not known.
